name: Karakatta
address: 230 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: One of the better ones! Excellentchashu pork
Amazing ramen. The peanut butter in the ramen was lovely and the pork had an amazing texture. Very cosy atmosphere. Make sure to chosen 1-2 if you can't tolerate spice.

The spicy ramen is one of the best, most flavorful ramen options currently in NYC. Especially if you like a little heat, this tiny gem of a restaurant is extremely underrated. With winter coming in, this is one of our go to spots.
The atmosphere is genuinely wonderful and very cozy. Probably good for a one on one meal! Food was great and filling!
food was amazing!! the people and the service was great as well!!!
Food was amazing! I‚Äôm glad i chose this place of all the ramen spots
The ramen was amazing and the staff was great!
Definitely coming back with friends!
Nice place, I like to come here after class
Best ramen in lower east
Authentic ramen and kind owner who is energetic! Recommend eating here especially if you want a taste of home!
Fantastic little place, the spicy ginger stamina ramen was absolutely delicious. Would recommend!
So good very flavorful very nice staff!

Pork belly was cooked perfectly. Egg was delicious and worth it.

Cute interior as well and Seungmin and Nina were really welcoming and helpful!

The ramen was absolutely delicious; although there is a limited menu, but I think the small selection allows for better quality.  In addition, the space itself was very cozy and intimate. Perfect for a lunch with a friend or a casual date. Seungmin and Nima are some of the best servers I‚Äôve ever had ever.
Nice casual place for ramen and other Asian options. Everything we had was good and considering the casual vibe and pricing even great.
Amazing !!!! Best ramen I have ever had and loved the cozy vibe ‚ú®
Good vegan options!

My absolute favorite ramen spot in the city. Great service as well. Crowded, but this spot is a gem. The pork buns are incredible, but the star is the ramen. I typically go spicy tonkotsu but you can‚Äôt go wrong here.

Our Friday Night Spot üçú‚ù§Ô∏è
Since discovering this place, my wife and I haven‚Äôt missed a single Friday. Out of all the ramen we‚Äôve had in NYC‚Äîand even Japan‚Äîthis one‚Äôs our champion.
The stamina ramen is my go-to comfort food now. It brings back the cozy, homemade feeling of something my grandma would‚Äôve made‚Äîhearty, rich, and full of soul.
The staff are always warm and welcoming, making us feel like true regulars. It‚Äôs more than dinner‚Äîit‚Äôs our weekly ritual.

Hands down my favorite ramen spot in the city! The spicy ginger stamina ramen is absolutely to die for‚Äîrich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. Cozy vibes, warm atmosphere, and some of the best service you‚Äôll ever find. A true gem.

Went because online on google it says theres udon on the menu - this however isnt true. Options consist of wavy thin ramen and some appetizers as well as rice meal options.

Honestly though, im not mad. I was quite impressed with how flavorful the broth was and the meat was super tender and tasty too. The ramen came out fast and the service was good. Overall, it was really delicious and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.
Great food. Wonderful and attentive staff.
This is my favorite ramen place in the city! It‚Äôs such a cute little spot and a great atmosphere. I love the cucumber salad and all the ramens are great!
Awesome ramen place! Rich flavor and great atmosphere.
Great food, great service!

We live near Toulouse in France and no ramen we have ever had in that city comes anywhere close to the ramen served here! We have been many times and it is the best, the stock, the meat, the vegetables everything is utterly devine. It's also not too expensive considering its location. The staff are really nice equally, go there!
The food tastes amazing and you can choose the level of spiciness. It‚Äôs a small cozy place.
Authentic Japanese ramen. Top notch bowl

This place is just amazing! Servers are so nice and gentle. They made sound recommendations. Place is well decorated,  nice asian environment. I would suggest trying to Spicy Ginger Stamina, 10/10, prices are fair enough for the quality!!  Thanks Nima for your great service!
Incredibly mid, ramen tasted closer to box ramen than restaurant quality

Small and cozy restaurant with amazing food.
I ordered a summer lemon ramen which was beyond expectations.
Must try, best spicy Ramen ever

Pretty good vegan curry ramen, but it didn‚Äôt quite live up to the hype. The vegan ramen has a little too much vegetable and not quite enough noodle or tofu (my bowl had three small cubes of tofu). The broth is rich, but not quite enough‚Ä¶
One of the best ramen I ever had highly recommended. Kudos to my server nima sweet and attentive
I don‚Äôt know how to say it. This is hands down the BEST ramen EVER!! We got the Vegan Spicy Curry level 5 spicy. We added fried garlic, 2x Bamboo Shoots, and fried chicken curry .
Great service and excellent food!!

Veryyyyy yummyyyy!!!!!!!! All the ramen was delicious and the appetizers were really delicious!!! The ramen broth was very light and not salty and the meat inside was soft and light. Above all, the atmosphere and the kindness of the staff were all the best.
I had food poisoning from the Tontonksu and vegan curry ramen :(
Wet‚Ä¶.no seriously, it‚Äôs that good

I love Taka‚Äôs shoyu ramen‚Äîflavorful with a great noodle texture, which is my favorite part. It‚Äôs a bit salty for my taste, but still very enjoyable.
The takoyaki is a unique twist‚Äîserved with cheese and spicy mayo on top. I love it!
really good ramens. maybe too spicy haha
Huge portions, nice noodles and brooth. Plus sake by glass or bottles. Perfect

Super restaurant ! C‚Äôest bon et le personnel est tr√®s accueillant et gentil üòä
Consistently delicious. Attentive and fast service. What more could you ask for?
Beautiful tiny place very cozy and friendly, the ramen was delicious I Think the best I try in NY so far
Crowded but great food
Delicious!

Tiny space, very close to Washington Square.
The Tonkotsu Ramen was near perfect - deep broth, beautiful meat pieces, perfect saltiness.
A chicken bun was juicy and spicy as an entree.
Very recommend.

This place is small but cozy, with a friendly atmosphere and excellent food! I ordered three different types of ramen, and all of them were delicious. I also loved that I could choose my preferred spice level! The house hot sake perfectly complemented the food as well!üëç One more thing! The appetizer was also perfect! Definitely a must-try alongside the ramen. I highly recommend this place!!!

My wife and I were craving ramen while in the area, so I checked out some nearby spots and read through reviews. We decided to try this place because it was the closest, and we‚Äôre so glad we did. The ramen was outstanding‚Äîdefinitely some of the best I‚Äôve had. The broth was rich and flavorful, and the noodles tasted handmade (I think!). Everything was spot-on. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed, and our food came out quickly. The only downside is that the space is quite small, so it might feel cramped if it‚Äôs busy. Luckily, we were there at a quieter time. I highly recommend this place‚Äîit‚Äôs truly fantastic!

Food is okay, hot soup and ramen is good on a cold day. Broth is flavorful but i think there are some better place out there with this price. Imo it is not actually worth for $20+ pre tax and tip for one small bowl of ramen. You also needed to pay more if you wanna make it more spicy

A small ramen restaurant with not so many seats. We visited on Sunday noon, and it‚Äôs pretty empty.
The restaurant is specialized with spicy noodles. My husband tried mild and I had the pork done soup with level 2 spicy. Level 2 is not spicy at all to me. The soup is rich, and the noodles are on the thin side.
The only thing I don‚Äôt like is the meat in the noodles. It is very fatty and tastes a bit cold inside. I cannot eat second bite.
We also ordered the appetizer sampler, I like the fired dumplings and fried chicken a lot.

This ramen was just what I needed on a cold day! Portion was a reasonable size (a bit smaller than most places) but was extremely flavorful! Got the spicy ginger ramen spice level 2 and wish I went a little spicier but was very happy with it!

Veryyy good ramen in a cute cosy spot! The spicy ginger ramen was so tasty, and definitely recommend the appetiser sampler! We also tried the white peach Chu-Hi cocktail in a can, so goood! Will come back ü§©

Really quaint spot. Great Tonkotsu; on top of that, they give you the option to chose your spice level which is not usual in a ramen spot. The vegan ramen wasn‚Äôt our favorite but they have a spicy curry vegan ramen bowl that looked really delicious. Other than that, ramune and sapporo to go with everything. Definitely keeping this spot in mind when in the area.

I love the Ramen here. This tight knit and cozy spot can be uncomfortable to enjoy a bowl of ramen but the presentation and food quality is to die for.

Come at night and enjoy the neon red glow bounce of your ramen bowl and table. Karakatta serves us what I like to call one of NYC‚Äôs best ramen spots around.

Yes, their bathroom can be cleaner and yes they should limit squeezing in people who lack awareness of their surroundings with their oversized purses and backpacks.

The decor is great, service is great and the serves are super friendly. The ramen price point can be just a bit high but you won‚Äôt be disappointed while you indulge in a bowl of their ramen. Be mindful of the soup base you get they are different in texture and thickness. I recommend the pork broth which sits perfect with their scallions, noodles, egg and protein option.

what an amazing ramen place in the city.
one of our fried recommended this place, since their broth is out of this world.
we reached around closing time but luckily got a seat.
had their tonkotsu - level 4 spicy and spicy black tantanmen - level 5.
their spice level is good and noodles are best.
Is a must try in NYC.
Small space, decent price, quick service!

Fusion-style ramen with spicy options and good vegetarian/ vegan options.

Small space. Only seats around 20-25 people at most inside.

The chicken meat had a really nice char to it but I felt my pork belly was a little too burnt and dry.

My favorite was the Vegan ramen was surprisingly very very good. I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the butter miso ramen. the Shoyu ramen is good for people who eat chicken. I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place for a group with vegan or vegetarian people though cause it has a good selection and well marked menu!

Downside is that it‚Äôs a little too loud since the space is small and it‚Äôs crowded inside. Some sound absorption items, like hanging felt panels or decorations on the ceiling or would really help.

We came in on a Saturday around 430 PM. Although it was packed, they gave us a 5 minute wait time and we were quickly seated soon after. It is quite tight if you sit at the stool near the window, but it has a nice atmosphere.

We got the miso broth ramen and spicy vegan ramen. Both were very delicious and filling. I loved the noodle texture! Next time, I'd probably go with a traditional tonkotsu broth.

Perfect on a rainy or cold day!

One of the best Ramen if not the best! Pork belly buns are always amazing, and the ramen never disappoints.
Our server was very friendly and attentive.
My only complain is having, who I believe could be owners/admin, take over 2 tables when they only have 2 tables for 4 (or 4 for 2 ppl) for their personal use. I feel they could have moved their work elsewhere. While we were enjoying our amazing meal they were also fixing one chair the entire time. A bit annoying.

Besides this, I highly recommend this place for ramen!

The restaurant is one of those places that if you walk by and pass by, you will want to enter.  The atmosphere is very enveloping and the lights are dim and since it is a small space, it makes it cozy.

The food was delicious, we ordered takoyaki and tonkotsu ramen. They were exquisite and the portions were big, we ordered one plate of each (there were two of us) and it was more than enough.
Although for me, the ramen had a lot of scallion and was somewhat saturated, but for everything else it was very delicious. To drink, we ordered Ramune (a very smooth and delicious Japanese soda) and we also ordered a Japanese cocktail that I don't remember the name of but it had something similar to jelly, it was very sweet and mild but we enjoyed it quite a bit.

The girl from the staff who served us was very friendly, she gave us very good suggestions regarding food and drinks and was attentive to everything.

Something important, we went with our cat and she was allowed as long as she was obedient (we had her inside the briefcase), there was no problem for our baby.

So if you want a cozy experience and to enjoy japanese food, this is the place.

A cute little hole in the wall! The staffs are friendly, and you will not be expected to stay here for long given how small it is.

We ordered the Karaage Buns, which is a bit expensive compared to the Karaage Chicken (so I would order the chicken next time instead). The buns texture are really good, just not justifiable for the price.

The Spicy Ginger Ramen is decent, cool fresh flavor with chewy noodles. However, the broth is a bit over seasoned so I didn't taste much of the meaty flavor. The Butter Miso Ramen is as expected, with just-enough-buttery broth. Both bowls have pork belly, which are a bit overcooked in my opinion.

I would be hesitant to come back out of my way, but certainly with friends for a quick meal.

Overall good ramen place! I personally went with level 3 spicy but I would recommend going 4, 3 was not spicy at all.

The service was great, the employees are pretty nice. Not exactly going to change your life in terms of flavor but it is tasty nevertheless.

Small ramen restaurant that specializes in spicy ramen. The bowls are highly customizable with different spice levels. If you‚Äôre looking for a lighter bowl, highly recommend the vegan ramen which comes in a rich soy milk broth and a lot of vegetables. The pork chashu was also flavorful and melts in the mouth

This place is quite small but their organize seats very well so didn‚Äôt feel uncomfortable. The ramen broth is was a little, maybe I need more soup for cold day but overall was delicious . Crispy chicken bun was great, juicy and crunchy outside. Services really nice and good of service mind.

I was initially annoyed at how slow the service was from waiting to have our orders taken to requesting for water to getting our ramen. Everything took forever even though it wasn‚Äôt very busy and there were a lot of waiters.

However the ramen was absolutely amazing and for that it overcompensated for the snail service.

The ramens cost between $18-$20 before tax and tips. I recommend the spicy ginger stamina over the tonkotsu which is surprising as I normally prefer pork broth over chicken.

If you love ramen or Japanese food in general this is a must try! I got the Tonkotsu ramen and it was easily the best I‚Äôve ever had. I also got the Pork Bun which was absolutely delicious. They give you a lot for what you pay and the quality is amazing. Our food came out in under 10 minutes and the service was amazing! The waters were so so nice and so helpful.

The place is quite small but charming, staff was very nice; we got taka‚Äôs vegan ramen and chicken ginger ramen. The broth is really tasty and the overall ramen really good. I would definitely come back again.

Excelente ramen, servido con detalle y productos de primera. El espacio es super sencillo, peque√±o y con un toque tradicional. Cada plato tiene 5 niveles de picor, lo cual lo hace accesible para todos los paladares.

Had a really good time at Karakatta.
I had pork-based ramen, and the broth was really good!
Butter miso was really interesting with a chicken broth. Highly recommended.
Beautiful ambience and great date spot! Ramen was huge portions that neither of us could finish. Love the neon glow in the New York late night. Prices were decent for Manhattan too. Highly recommend!

Average ramen. To my taste very thick and fatty pork broth. The noodles were sticky and there was like a sticky cold ball with noodles inside, of the size of gold ball. Pork belly is OK. The service is nice and fast.

Always consistently delicious! Had spicy ginger ramen recently and asked for a minimum amount of spice and it was great. So even if you normally don‚Äôt eat spicy food, ask for the minimum and it‚Äôs quite delicious

Ramen is decent but doesn‚Äôt amaze me. It can be a bit pricey for the portion. The swerving speed can be improved. We ordered an appetizer and it only came after we almost finished our ramen. The wait outside can be long at times as there‚Äôs only a little seats inside.

Just amazing ramen! We were here with my boyfriend on Xmas day, the place is small but cozy. We were seated on the kitchen counter overlooking the chef. We had some beer to start followed by the ramen. Hard to explain in words, the ramen was just so so so good. Glad we chose this place!

Karakatta is near the Washington Square park in NYC. We heard a lot of good reviews about this place from our friends. The place is extremely small with about 8 tables for 2 but the ramen is very good. We started with the Karrage Chicken (which is almost our staple at any ramen place ) which was delicious and a ramen with Chicken broth & protein. The food thing about this place is that you can specify the spice level with all the ramen being at spice level 1. But surely worth a try when near the Washington Square Park.

Had the vegan spicy curry ramen. It was delicious at the beginning and the noodle, veggies and broth combination was perfect. However, once I finished my noodles, the curry itself became a bit boring, and I couldn‚Äôt finish it.

They have limited space so you might end up sitting in cramped up bar like seats instead of a table. Overall, it‚Äôs a great spot for a quick but satisfying meal!
